title: Liverpool
name: Greek Orthodox Church of St Nicholas
content: Dedicated to St Nicholas the patron saint of seafarers. Built between 1865 and 1870, it was the second purpose built Greek Orthodox Church in England. The architecture of the building is a typical example of the Byzantine style as used in many Eastern Greek Churches. A typical feature is the four domes of the building. Henry Summers, master builder who built many fine examples of architecture in Liverpool, was commissioned to build the church.
